meanings.sent1: I will expend all my energy on this project.
meanings.sent2: She likes to expend her allowance on toys.
meanings.sent3: Don't expend all your snacks before the movie starts!
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the task was like a flame that could not be expended.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner had to carefully manage his energy to not expend it too soon.

meanings.sent1: The company will expend a large sum on advertising.
meanings.sent2: They decided to expend their savings on a vacation.
meanings.sent3: He didn't want to expend money on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a currency she never hesitated to expend.
meanings.sent5: The explorer had to expend his resources wisely in the unknown territory.

meanings.definition: To put forth or employ in doing something
meanings.sent1: He will expend great effort to finish the race.
meanings.sent2: The chef will expend his skills to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: She had to expend her creativity to solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The artist expended his emotions onto the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will expend her knowledge to help her students succeed.
